page.title: 10EPSOM COLLEGE
page.content: {Epsom College,}an independent boarding school, was opened in 1855 by John Propert as the{Royal Medical {Benevolent College}in order to provide accomodation for pensioners with medical connections and for orphans of medical families.{The opening was {attended by Prince Albert}and the college has been patronised by the Monarch ever since.{The Queen and {H.R.H the Duke of Edinburgh attended {the school's centenary in 1955. Originally the school housed 100 pensioners and 100 boys. Now it accomodates 630 pupils (including 350 boarders) of whom some 50-60 are girls in the 6th form (first admitted 1976). The school has a strong science bias, illustrated by its unique biological museum, but is also strong in other areas. With an 80 acre site the school is very strong in major sports.
